iati-activity.title: Sense Scotland:Malawi Deaf/Deafblind Education
iati-activity.description: This project will increase the number of deaf and deafblind children in education in Northern Malawi and raise awareness of their needs and rights amongst parents, teachers and other relevant professionals, through the development of a Northern Council of Deafness. A Scottish Government supported pilot survey (2008-09) across four Education Districts in the north of Malawi found no deaf/blind children in education and highlighted a demand from parents and teachers for sensitisation and communication training to counteract cultural beliefs and taboos surrounding deaf/deafblind children. The Council will include representatives of deaf individuals, families, PTAs, schools, and other appropriate organisations to support, promote and lobby for deaf/deafblind education, family support and equality. Activities will include the delivery of community awareness programmes, parent workshops and sports, arts and drama activities to increase the skills and competences of deaf/deafblind children. Sense Scotland will also organise a conference midway through the project to bring relevant individuals, professionals and government representatives together around deaf/deafblind issues.
